text: I am 35 years old and have had hearing aids since I was 5. I have ALWAYS used Beltone for my hearing needs. I have used Beltone in Cullman Alabama for the last 10 years. The Cullman branch is so responsive, respectful and friendly.  If you ever need testing or help, then go see Zach and Deanna in Cullman! They won't let you down!

text: I've had Beltone hearing aids for years.   I started using this location when I started to work in Cullman about 4 years ago and they are the best.  Zach is always so professional and willing to help in any way he can.  He listens and understands and works with you to get the settings correct.  I am probably his worst nightmare about tweaking the settings for me, but he always gets them right no how many times I say the right ear needs just a little more or less.  Deanna, his assistant,  is awesome as well and so helpful.  Both Zach and Deanna are professional and so easy to work with.   Of all of the locations that I have  used, this is the best. name: Richard Gurley
text: I recently obtained a new hearing aid from Beltone.  I have had Beltone hearing aids before and got this upgrade.  The personnel at the Cullman office were super.  They were always attentive to my questions, friendly and pleasant and full of knowledge.  The hearing aid that was suggested for my problem has been wonderful.  It is clearer that any aid I have had before and I can now hear more clearly that in years.  I also got the remote control, which is the best thing since sliced bread.  The program that reduces background noise is my favorite.  When we go to a restaurant, I simply click to that program and I can hear those at my table clearly and not be distracted by the noise in the restaurant.  I have used this program at other places also, but it is most noticeable in restaurants. (Maybe it is because we eat out a lot)  I would highly recommend this hearing aid and the Cullman outlet for anyone that needs a hearing aid.

I am very pleased with the service I received from the Cullman, AL staff. Zac and Alissa were very helpful throughout the entire process. Working through some unique hearing issues has been a little challenging. Courteous, knowledgeable staff is key to a successful operation.

I am very pleased with the product I purchased. Having the Bluetooth and different settings options are fantastic. Though quite expensive, these aids are the best.

I would definitely recommend Beltone and especially the staff in the Cullman office.

Tim Frazier

name: Jeff Harrison
text: I went there April 7 and I have STILL not received hearing aid.My insurance people have now scheduled me an appointment with a different ear doctor.I am under the impression that since I am disabled and on Medicare,maybe the doctor doesn't receive the lions share of the profit,so he just doesn't care.I can't even remember his name,it's been so long.Anyway,this is the worst experience I have ever had regarding health matters.

resp.text: Jeff, sorry to hear you are disappointed in the clinic and the response to your hearing needs. Unfortunately the issue has less to do with money then it does the insurance credentialing process. Your insurance had sent you to our clinic and we have been diligently working through the credential process so that we may get you the promised hearing aids that are covered by your insurer at 100%, with no out of pocket expense to you. This can take some time, typically up to 90 days, and the office staff did explain this to you. We will continue working on this and can stay in touch when the process is completed. Thanks.

name: Don Meyer
text:
Tony did a hearing test and recommended Audibel Via AI hearing aids to deal with he hearing deficiency that I have.  I had been wearing older Starkey hearing aids for about 4 years so hearing aids was not a new experience to me.

After some research I decided to accept Tony's offer for the Via AI aids.  At the first appointment Tony Set up the aids and the Thrive APP on my phone.  I like being able to change setting on the aids through the app.  We found that there is an issue using iPhone 6 and older phones with the app due to Apple upgrading the iOS after i6.  It does work for now but it tends to drop connecting with the aids.  When it does you close the app and restart it.

During both sessions Tony got assistance from an outside consultant with questions that I had raised.  On the second session Tony moved the settings closer to my ideal setting

Overall I do hear better than I did with the old aids.

At all times Tony acted in a professional manner.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review! Tony is the best, we are happy to have been able to help.

name: Brenda Thompson
text: Royce Howard on Tony he is knowledable patient and pleasant     Carla is efficient runs an efficient and pleasant office .                            Peggy Howard on Tony he speaks where I can understand him even when he has my hearing aids out. He has time for my questions.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review!

resp.text: Thank you for leaving us a 5-star review! Nick and Savannah make a great team and are always available to help whether you have Miracle-Ear hearing aids or not! Thank you for your service. You might be interested to know that every Miracle-Ear office in Alabama is veteran owned. Don't hesitate to give us a call if we can help you in any way.

name: David Porter
text: I bought a pair of hearing aids from Nick Olsen several months ago and couldn't be more please with his service and with the hearing aids I purchased.  I had purchased some inexpensive hearing aids over the internet and they helped a little but not much.  Truthfully I just didn't want to wear them.  I sat down with Nick and when I put the hearing aids on I could actually hear again. Pretty amazing!  And they work all the time.  It has changed the quality of my life.  I can enter into the conversations going on around me because I can hear. And I don't mind wearing something that works.  I highly recommend Nick Olsen and Miracle Ear's product.

resp.text:
Thanks for sharing your story! A lot of people will search online for information about hearing aids, and to be honest there are a lot of products on the internet claiming to do a lot of things.

We're really glad you decided to sit down with Nick to get professional care for your hearing. Hearing aids aren't "one size fits all" or "set it and forget it", they require professional testing and care, and we couldn't be more proud to provide products and services that have changed the quality of your life.

name: George Sanders
text: Awesome experience. Very friendly staff.

name: steve cooper
text: Great product and wonderful staff

name: Edward Sims
text: Although Im still getting use to my hearing aids, they have opened a totally new world for me. Sounds I never knew existed around me are pleasantly surprising me to no end. Each day brings something new. Never knew what I was missing. Ongoing but just great and I love the service too.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your experience, and we look forward to being there throughout your journey. We call it "the light-bulb moment", that's when our patients put hearing aids in for the first time and start hearing things they haven't heard in years (or ever!). There are countless examples of the sounds of every day life that are truly amazing, everything from conversations with friends and loved ones to the birds chirping. Don't hesitate to give us a call anytime you need us, otherwise we'll see you at your follow-up appointments.

text: POOR SCHEDULING!!!  Had a appointment on June 5, 2018 for 11am.  When I walked in the receptionist said my appointment was not until 11:30am. I showed her the card SHE HAD WROTE OUT for 11:00am, she said “oh well it will be fine”.   After she let me sit there for over 30 minutes, while she chit chatted with everyone in the lobby, the receptionist called me back just to clean my hearing aids!!!   I never saw the audiologist!!!   I had another appointment today August 21, 2018 for 11:30am. After sitting there for another 30 minutes and 1 person that came in after me being seen before me I walked out. name: Sibyl Fondren
text:
I'd been plagued with monthly sinus infections with intense pressure and pain for over a year.  During that time I saw 3 different ENTs without any long term change.  I had tried the prescribed sinus irrigation, Flonase, countless rounds of antibiotics etc. to the point I was living on decongestants to get any relief.
Dr. Benoit was the first to suggest taking a CT scan. He listened to my history and seemed to genuinely want to help me find relief. He showed me the CT scan and explained how my deviated septum and enlarged turbinates were swelling and causing not only pain but blockage which wasn't allowing mucus out or helpful medications in! He suggested a septoplasty with turbinate reduction.
My surgery was November 16, 2016 and I have had continually improving symptoms.  I have yet to have a sinus infection, I can breathe freely through both nostrils (something I never realized I couldn't do!), clearing my sinuses is a breeze now and my Flonase can actually get where it needs to go!

A huge thanks to Dr. Benoit and his friendly, efficient staff! I couldn't imagine an easier experience or a better outcome!

text: I always receive prompt attention and great service.  Jason is professional, respectful, courteous, and attentive.  I had another brand of hearing aids before, but the product nor the service came close to what I have experienced with Miracle-Ear.  One of the aspects I particularly like is that during the hearing test, the tester actually talks and listens to what I say and responds.  The tester from the other company never talked to me during the test and, therefore, never truly understood all aspects of my hearing issue.  So thankful that I started with Miracle-Ear!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave this review.  You touched on one of the most important parts of the better hearing journey, and that's the attention and care you received from Jason.  Hearing loss is unique to each person, and it takes attention to detail and professional experience to get the most out of the hearing device.  Thanks again, and please don't hesitate to call if we can help you in any way.

resp.text: Thank you for leaving this review! Hearing aids aren't "one size fits all" because everyone's hearing loss is different. name: Jane Barnes Weeks
text: Took my Mother in for a hearing test and ended up purchasing hearing aids.  Staff was very friendly and knowledgeable.  My Mother is 88.  They took their time with her and had so much patience with her also.  I highly recommend them.

resp.text: Thanks for leaving us a 5-star review, and thank you for bringing your Mother into our office.  We look forward to walking with her (and you!) on her journey to better hearing.  We'll be here every step of the way, and if you need anything before your next appointments please don't hesitate to give Jason and Val a call.  We're here to help!

name: Charles Frye
text: I travel a lot around the country and wanted a hearing aid provider that I could go to in any state, if I had a problem. It turned out that Miracle Ear was a perfect fit for me with that situation. I found Jason's operation on the internet and called to make an appointment. Jason and his staff were very helpful and took the time I needed for them to answer all my questions about the hearing aids , what to expect from them, and how to take care of them. It took a couple of appointments to get them set correctly for me. I think it was due to me having them for the first time. But Jason always made time for me to come in, because of my time frame leaving the state again. I would say he went above and beyond to help me. I would recommend him to anyone that needed to have hearing aids.

resp.text: You're exactly right, Miracle-Ear has over 1,500 locations nationwide that you can go to for any of your needs.  Thanks for sharing your story.  You're exactly right, for many first-time hearing aid wearers there is a short acclimation and adjustment period.  Many of the sounds that have been lost are being reintroduced and it takes care and professional experience to get that right, and it's different for every single patient.  There is no "one size fits all" hearing aid!  Please don't hesitate to give us a call, we are always happy to help.

name: Bill Brooks
text:
The staff at Miracle Ear are great! They gave me an exceptionally thorough analysis of my hearing, and then showed me some of the options that would improve the areas where I was having trouble. My only regret is that I waited so long to reach out for hearing loss assistance.

I'd been in denial about my hearing loss for some time, but realized the time had come to get professional help when meetings seemed like I lived in the Tower of Babel. A friend recommended Miracle Ear, so I did some research, read reviews, and contacted Clarke White for an appointment. My Miracle Ear iRHYTHMs are nothing short of fantastic! Not only are they adjustable to  a specific direction (front, back, sides, a combination, or 360), they allow me to stream, via Blue Tooth, from my television. They are also rechargeable.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your story.  A lot of our patients were referred to us by their friends and family, and we're always so happy to build a relationship with someone new.  Taking the steps toward better hearing can take some time, but rest assured that we are here to help in any way we can.  We have great technology (as you mentioned with the new iRHYTHM hearing devices), but equally as important is that we have great people in our offices that can walk with you each step of the way through the journey.  Thanks for leaving us a review!

my mom, who is a talker.   He replaces the tubes and cleans them whenever she needs it.  The quality of the hearing devices is outstanding and having someone who really cares makes all the difference in the initial purchase. text: I have suffered from sinus issues and infections for over 25 years. I have seen other specialists. Dr. Robertson is by far the best ENT I have ever been treated by. The surgery was scheduled quickly and the care was fantastic. The recovery was not bad at all. I have never felt better in my life. I can finally breathe through my nose with no obstruction, and I am not getting a sinus infection every month anymore. My family can even tell a difference in my mood. The surgery has been life changing. If you need ENT care, Dr. Robertson and his people are incredible.  Highly recommend.

text:
Went in, thought I had bad allergy, was told by Dr Robertson I was allergic to  everything but mold and mildew. I had a bad feeling about it then. He suggested surgery to get air moving, idiot like I agreed. I could tell no difference after healing, didn't approach my original problem. I feel he wanted to pad his pocket at my expense.
I went to another Doctor, he didn't do the age old skin prick test, he drew blood and sent it off to be tested. Came back I was allergic to dogs only and just enough to register on the test it was so slight. Said I will probably have to have surgery to get it straight. Dr Robertson didn't do the job right.  He only did part of the job needed, why would he not do the whole job and not put someone through all that again?
GO AT YOUR OWN RISK!

text: My experience started off good and went horribly wrong from there. Working in the health field I've learned that a patients health history pays a vital key in treatment. I show up to my 5:45 appointment for my surgery apparently no one from the nurses to the doctor reviewed my medical history which stated that I was anemic . After being prepped for my surgery I was then told that I wouldn't be having the surgery due to me being anemic. Which was stated that same day more than once to two different people. On top of wasting my time, including the week that I had already taken time off from work which was now a waste, I was told that I could  call back in two - three months once I was "cleared" to have the surgery! I wouldn't recommended to anyone who has any type of predisposed health issue.

resp.text: We are so sorry for the inconvenience.  We always put our patient's safety first.  Unfortunately, safety concerns can arise at any time.  Please give us a call if you have any additional questions.  Thank you!

name: Kevin Foote
text: Dr. Robertson changed my life! I visited him after hearing a radio commercial about balloon sinuplasty, and I was skeptical at first but after years and years of chronic sinus problems, I was desperate to try anything. Dr. Robertson was very warm & personable, and I could tell he really cares. Most doctors I've met are sort of callous, and it's hard to find one that'll talk to you like a real person. Kudos to Dr. Robertson for making me feel comfortable about this, because it's a lot to consider & a lot of money. I elected to go with the procedure, and I'm so glad that I did. I can breathe so much better now, I'm sleeping better, and I'm no longer constantly bothered by my sinuses throughout the day. I'm not breathing perfectly, of course, but I can definitely feel a significant improvement. I think as long as you're nor expecting rainbows & unicorns but can keep your expectations reasonable, you'll be satisfied. If I could go back in time, I would have the procedure again. Thank you Dr. Robertson!

name: JP
text: Dr. Robertson is a great doctor.  The best ENT in Birmingham. Dr. Robertson performed sinus surgery on me back in 1998. I was having severe miagrane headaches that would last for days.  After surgery I felt 100% better. I was amazed at the result. Also Dr. Robertson does NOT pack your sinuses after surgery. Today I'm still doing great and haven't had any other problems with my sinuses.

name: Deana Mumpower
text:
I have had chronic sinus infections  for years.  My ears felt stopped up which was affecting my hearing.  Dr Robertson found the problem.  He suggested balloon  sinuplasty.  This has enabled my sinuses to drain properly and has alleviated  constant sinusitis. This procedure also opened my  ears.
The balloon sinuplasty  helped me so much, I took my mother (90) to see Dr Robertson.  She has had constant sinus problems for years.  Dr Robertson suggested the same procedure.  She is having great results, also.

name: Sweet Home Alamanda
text:
Dr. Robertson is absolutely amazing. I originally went in to see him about sinus issues that were making me miserable. He suggested that I undergo allergy testing. I did and my results revealed that I was allergic to 90% of what I was tested for, and I was severely allergic to most of those. I have started Rush Immunology and I look forward to feeling better in the future! Due to my anatomy (as found on CT Scan) Dr. Robertson recommended surgical intervention, and he performed a Septoplasty on me as well as addressed several other sinus-related issues during the procedure. Yes, post-op pn is never fun, but I am hoping to reap the benefits of the surgery in the near future.
I cannot thank Dr. Robertson enough as he has been so knowledgeable and helpful in explaining exactly what he feels is going on with my allergy and sinus issues. When I first met him, he came in and sat down and took plenty of time speaking with me...even after being in a long day of surgery. He is never rushed in my appts, and spends a good amount of time explaining things. His staff has also been so friendly, helpful and knowledgeable as well. I appreciate Dr. Robertson and his awesome staff more than they will ever know! Thank you ALL so very much!!!
(*FYI regarding another review below, the blood test used for allergy testing is NOT AT ALL considered to be the most effective at finding accurate results; research this)
